result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anita L Hill in court with attorney Anna M Kees.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case dismissed and read into 14CT1889.

ADDRESS INFO for Anita L Hill
Current: C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53189   (Effective: 05-13-2016)
Prior: 1521 Big Bend Road, #101, Waukesha, WI 53189
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: May 4, 2016
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
dated April 12, 2016   Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel Atty M. Elizabeth Weathers  (sent in error, this case is no longer assigned to Atty Weathers)
Hearing on May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court. Defendant allowed 2 non collect calls.

Defendant Anita L Hill in court, in custody, with attorney Anthony Rosario for  M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Return of Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture, Anita Hill
New cash bond set in the amount of 1000.00 upon return of the warrant.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Anita L Hill did not appear.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court revokes/forfeits bail.  Issues a capias, cashbail in the amount of $1,000.00.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
